data.title: California State University (CSU)
data.meta_description: Twenty-Three CSU Transfer Options One Application Image
data.text:
Twenty-Three CSU Transfer Options

One Application

The California State University (CSU) system is made up of 23 campuses statewide offering thousands of degrees to choose from. Explore your campus choices below for more information.

Application Deadlines

Fall Admission: October 1-November 30 (all campuses & majors open)

Spring Admission: August 1-31 (select campuses & majors)

Admission Website: Cal State Apply

Transfer Requirements

Complete the "Golden Four" requirements as soon as you can. Complete one course, with a grade "C" or higher, in each of the four areas below:

A1: Oral Communication

A2: Written Communication

A3: Critical Thinking

B4: Mathematics/Quantitative Reasoning

Complete a minimum of 60-CSU transferrable units with at least a 2.0 GPA. However, some campuses and/or majors may require a higher GPA.

Complete lower-division coursework required for your major. Universities show the course requirements for each of the degrees they offer in their catalogs, which can be accessed online. Some universities provide information about articulation by major on www.assist.org

Campuses & Undergraduate Majors
